description.en: The course provides an overview of the main principles behind writing a scholarly literature review and formulating one's publishing strategies. After getting acquainted with relevant research literature, the participants of the course will compile their strategies for  publishing peer-reviewed academic articles and present and discuss these at the final seminar of the course.
description.et: Kursus käsitleb erialakirjanduse ülevaate koostamise ja teaduspublikatsioonide kavandamise põhimõtteid ning lõpeb kirjanduse ülevaatel põhineva publitseerimisplaani koostamise ja selle aruteluga doktoriseminaris.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to develop students skills in analysing academic literature and in planning publishing their research findings.
objectives.et: Ainekursuse eesmärk on arendada doktorandi oskusi analüüsida erialakirjandust ja planeerida uurimistöö tulemuste publitseerimist.

learning_outcomes.en: After taking the course the doctoral student:
-	is well aquainted with the academic literature relevant to their thesis project;
-	is able to identify research gaps and pose research questions;
learning_outcomes.et: - suudab leida uurimistühikuid ja sõnastada uurimisküsimusi;

learning_outcomes.en: -	is able to plan one's academic publishing strategies accordingly.

notes.et: Õppetöö toimub inglise keeles, kui ainekursusel osalevad välisdoktorandid.

independent_work.et:
Kirjanduse ülevaatel põhinev publitseerimisplaan: Doktorant koostab oma doktoriuurimuse seisukohast olulise kirjanduse ülevaate, milles demonstreerib oskust analüüsida kirjandust kriitiliselt, leida uurimistühikud, püstitada uurimisküsimused ja kavandada nendele vastavalt publikatsioone. Töö koosneb 3 osast: (1) Kirjanduse ülevaade; (2) Uurimistühiku(te) määratlemine ja uurimisküsimuste sõnastamine; (3) Sihtajakirjade loetelu koos iga ajakirja valiku põhjenduse ja artiklite valmimise ajakavaga. Iseseisva töö soovituslik pikkus: 15-20 lk + kirjanduse loetelu.

Compiling a literature review based publishing strategy: 
A doctoral student will compile a literature review on the topic of their PhD project. The literature review will illustrate the student's abilities to critically assess relevant research literature, to identify research gaps, to pose research questions and to plan publishing one's doctoral research accordingly. The assignment will consist of three parts: (1) Compiling a literature review; (2) Identifying research gap(s) and drafting relevant research questions; (3) compiling a list of potential target journals / academic peer-reviewed outlets, supported by explanations and justifications for one's choices, as well as a timeframe for publishing. Recommended length: 15-20 pages + references.

grade_evaluation.et:
Arvestuse saamiseks koostab doktorant kirjanduse ülevaatel põhineva publitseerimisplaani ning esitleb seda doktoriseminaril.

To pass the course the student needs to compile a literature-review-based publishing strategy for one's doctoral dissertation and to present the strategy at a doctoral seminar.

resources.recommended_materials:
Nygaard, L. P. & Solli, K. (2020). Strategies for writing a thesis by publication in the social sciences and humanities. Routledge. 

Salmonds, J. & Kara, J. (2020). Publishing from your doctoral research: Create and use a publication strategy. Routledge. 

Thomson, P. & Kamler, B. (2013). Writing for peer reviewed journals: Strategies for getting published. Routledge. 

Trafford, V., & Shosh, L. (2008) Stepping stones to achieving your doctorate: Focusing on your viva from the start. Maidenhead; New York: McGraw-Hill/Open University Press.

Wellington, J. (2003). Getting published: A guide for lecturers and researchers. Routledge.
